abstract_summ: Pregnant women with diabetes are more vulnerable to the severe effects of COVID-19 and advised to stringently follow social distancing measures . Majority of antenatal diabetes and obstetric visits are provided remotely, with pregnant women attending hospital clinics only for essential ultrasound scans and labour and delivery . Alternative screening procedures have for diagnosing hyperglycaemia during pregnancy and Gestational Diabetes (GDM) are discussed . Case histories describe the remote initiation of insulin pump therapy and automated insulin delivery in T1D pregnancy .
